required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Midwifery Students' Performance Before and After Teaching Fundamentals of Documentation

brief_summary.textblock: Midwives are responsible for documenting and keeping care facts in midwifery departments. Inaccurate documentation or even minute error in reporting may lead to burdensome responsibility for midwives. This study has been conducted aimed to compare midwifery students' performance before and after teaching fundamentals of documentation. In this quasi-experimental study, 28 midwifery students were participated. Data were collected by a questionnaire including a. demographic data and b. Scenarios (1) and (2) of an imaginary patient with physician order and a checklist contain 11 elements of documentation

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label

primary_outcome.measure: compare midwifery students' performance before and after teaching fundamentals of documentation using lecture method

arm_group.description: all midwifery students studying at last term (except one who was absent) (27) in Mashhad school of nursing and midwifery in April 2011

intervention.description: Teaching documentation skill using lecture method

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- midwifery students studying at mashhad school of nursing and midwifery
Exclusion Criteria:
- any other discipline

clinical_study.keyword: Students practice, Lecture; Nursing records; Nursing education; Midwifery
